Key Match Events: Gooool for Ecuador, the first goal for the home side, a rebound left by the goalkeeper for the striker Angel Mena to just push the ball into the net.
Ecuador are looking to go forward and attack to try and score a second goal to give them a more comfortable lead.
Chile are looking more dangerous but are still not finding clarity in the final area of the pitch.
The Chilean national team made offensive changes with the introduction of Felipe Loyola in an attempt to level the score.
Pre-Game Insights: The record is very close, as they have met on 9 occasions, leaving a record of 4 games won by Ecuador, a draw and 4 games won by the Chilean national team, despite this record, the favorite to take the 3 points will be Ecuador, as they are in a better moment and have players of much better quality.

The Ecuadorian national team comes from a valuable draw in Venezuela with no goals, a game that had many arrivals and for much of the game they suffered a lot because of the pressure exerted by Venezuela, finally getting a point to place in 6th position with 5 points and a record of 2 wins, 2 draws and a loss, They will be looking for a win against Chile, taking advantage of the fact that they will be playing with their fans and in their stadium. If they win tomorrow, they could be in 4th position

The Chilean national team comes from a scoreless draw against Paraguay, a match that was full of arrivals and above all many fouls, same that caused two red cards, is in 8th position with 5 points and a record of one game won, two draws and two defeats, will seek to defeat Ecuador in a tough visit, with the need to get the 3 points to be able to aspire to the classification
Post-Match Reflections: Ecuador are taking the 3 points in this match day 6 in the Conmebol Qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Full house for this match that promises a lot of intensity, goals and emotions, many more Ecuadorian fans present and not abandoning their national team for this very important match.
